intro: Teucrium cavanillesii, commonly known as the Canary Island germander, is a perennial herb native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom from spring to early summer. Teucrium cavanillesii is often found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
